name: get_financial_standards_authority
description: Return the authoritative GAAP (ASC) and USALI ruleset and scope for the L+B hospitality financial model. Use this as the single source of truth for statement structure, classification, eliminations, and ambiguity handling.

authority_payload.objective: Ensure all financial statements, calculations, and classifications for a U.S. hospitality platform are compliant with U.S. GAAP and hospitality industry standards.

relevant_topics.description: Revenue from Contracts with Customers (management fees, services)
Property, Plant, and Equipment (hotel assets, depreciation)

hospitality_industry.name: Uniform System of Accounts for the Lodging Industry (USALI)
hospitality_industry.purpose: Defines standard departmental reporting, revenue and expense categories, and hospitality KPIs

chart_of_accounts_reference.description: Example USALI-aligned hospitality chart of accounts

entities.description: Each hotel property is a standalone business entity with full GAAP financial statements
Provides services to properties and charges management and service fees

reporting_outputs: Property-level Income Statement, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow
Portfolio aggregate (sum of properties, no eliminations)
Consolidated group statements with intercompany eliminations

general: USALI governs departmental structure and hospitality KPIs
ASC governs recognition, measurement, and presentation
Conservative, standard U.S. practice is preferred
income_statement: Management fees recorded as revenue for OpCo and expense for properties
Operating metrics must align with USALI definitions (GOP, NOI, RevPAR, TRevPAR)
balance_sheet: Hotel property recorded as Property, Plant & Equipment under ASC 360
Debt recorded as liability under ASC 470
Equity contributions and distributions tracked explicitly
cash_flow_statement: Operating, Investing, and Financing sections classified per ASC 230
Debt issuance and payoff classified as Financing cash flows
Capital expenditures classified as Investing cash flows
refinancing: Old debt must be extinguished before new debt is recorded
Cash-out proceeds flow to equity as Financing cash flow
Refinancing fees and penalties classified per stated accounting policy
consolidation: Intercompany revenues and expenses must eliminate in consolidated statements
Intercompany receivables and payables must eliminate if tracked

prohibitions: Do not override GAAP classification rules
Do not apply systemwide catering assumptions when property-level assumptions exist

ambiguity_handling.rule: If guidance is unclear or conflicting, explicitly flag the ambiguity
ambiguity_handling.required_action: Cite the relevant ASC or USALI reference and explain the uncertainty

requirements: Clear labeling of entities and reporting layer
